content.description: This route is too short but the finger crack and thin hands are great wile they last. Start on the ledge or Start from the ground and do an unprotected easy boulder problem to the ledge. Thoughtful climbing ends as quickly as it began. Not worth hiking there just for this but if your hiking off from one of the trad multi’s you should stop and bag it.
content.protection: Gear to 1”. Trad anchor on top. Down climb the north side 4th class scramble.
content.location: On the northeast side of the crag. The only obvious crack going up it.

content.description:
A fun route to a fine summit with a superb view.

 Scramble approach to the south side of Arrowpoint.  Contour around the base of the formation to the west.

 Climb up nifty and reasonably secure crack system on the Northwest Corner.

 Plan on a downclimb of the route due to lack of robust summit anchors.
content.protection: A couple cams in the medium to 3" size range.  No secure top anchors (plan on down climbing).
content.location: Located on the Northwest side of the formation.

content.description: This Is the spire that’s not a part of the two main towers with the giant gully splitting them. It sits slightly west of the other two spires at the top and the unmaintained trail scoots along the west side of it.
